alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lewis (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 20 at 12:02PM EST until December 21 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York... Black River At Watertown affecting Lewis and Jefferson Counties. For the Black River...including Boonville, Watertown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River at Watertown. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flood stage, farmland flooding begins in the Flats with some roads flooded. Minor damages to riverfront commercial properties in Dexter. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM EST Wednesday was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.5 feet on 04/08/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1215 AM EST.
